IR-ID-01.description: Determine the extent of the incident, affected users, systems, and time range.
IR-ID-01.implementation_guidance: Review reported email content, headers, timestamps, affected accounts, and any related alerts or logs to understand how far the incident may have spread.
IR-ID-01.risk_if_skipped: Underestimating scope may result in incomplete containment and continued compromise.

IR-ID-02.description: Preserve relevant evidence for investigation and potential escalation.
IR-ID-02.implementation_guidance: Secure copies of emails, logs, and affected system data. Avoid modifying original artifacts until evidence is preserved.
IR-ID-02.risk_if_skipped: Loss of evidence may prevent root cause analysis or compliance investigations.

IR-CON-01.description: Prevent further spread or misuse by isolating impacted assets.
IR-CON-01.implementation_guidance: Temporarily disable affected user accounts or isolate systems from the network without powering them off.
IR-CON-01.risk_if_skipped: Attackers may continue lateral movement or data access.

IR-CON-02.description: Immediately stop unauthorized access using exposed credentials.
IR-CON-02.implementation_guidance: Disable the account, reset credentials, invalidate active sessions, and enforce reauthentication.
IR-CON-02.risk_if_skipped: Compromised credentials may continue to be abused.

IR-CON-03.description: Inform the affected user about the incident and required actions.
IR-CON-03.implementation_guidance: Advise the user not to interact further with the suspicious content and to report any additional anomalies.
IR-CON-03.risk_if_skipped: User may unknowingly worsen the incident or repeat unsafe behavior.

IR-ERAD-01.description: Eliminate malicious content or access paths from the environment.
IR-ERAD-01.implementation_guidance: Delete phishing emails from mailboxes, revoke malicious links, and remove unauthorized access tokens.

IR-ERAD-02.description: Ensure previously exposed credentials can no longer be used.
IR-ERAD-02.implementation_guidance: Force password resets, rotate access keys, and review privileged access assignments.
IR-ERAD-02.risk_if_skipped: Attackers may regain access using unchanged credentials.

IR-REC-01.description: Confirm that affected systems and accounts are operating securely.
IR-REC-01.implementation_guidance: Monitor logs, validate authentication behavior, and ensure no unauthorized changes persist.
IR-REC-01.risk_if_skipped: Undetected persistence mechanisms may remain active.

IR-REC-02.description: Safely return systems and users to normal operational status.
IR-REC-02.implementation_guidance: Re-enable accounts or systems after validation and ensure users can resume work securely.
IR-REC-02.risk_if_skipped: Prolonged disruption or insecure restoration may occur.

IR-POST-01.description: Analyze the incident, response effectiveness, and identify lessons learned.
IR-POST-01.implementation_guidance: Document incident timeline, assess response gaps, and update incident response procedures.
IR-POST-01.risk_if_skipped: Recurring incidents may occur due to unresolved weaknesses.

IR-POST-02.description: Reduce likelihood of similar incidents in the future.
IR-POST-02.implementation_guidance: Update training materials, refine email filtering rules, and improve authentication controls if necessary.
IR-POST-02.risk_if_skipped: Same attack patterns may succeed again.
